revision.comment: more recent photo, move other photo further down
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Thomas Middleditch | image = Thomas Middleditch by Gage Skidmore.jpg | alt = | caption = Middleditch at the 2018 [[San Diego Comic-Con]] | birth_name = Thomas Steven Middleditch | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1982|3|10}} | birth_place = {{nowrap|[[Nelson, British Columbia]], [[Canada]]}} | alma mater = [[University of Victoria]] | occupation = {{Flat list| * Actor * screenwriter }} | years_active = 2009–present | spouse = {{marriage|Mollie Gates|2015}} }}
'''Thomas Steven Middleditch'''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/tv/features/thomas-middleditch-patrick-stewart-silicon-valley-blunt-talk-1201794682/|title=Thomas Middleditch and Patrick Stewart on Doing Standup, Nicknames and Crazy Fan Encounters|website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=Debra|last=Birnbaum|date=June 14, 2016}}</ref> (born March 10, 1982) is a Canadian actor and television writer, known for his role as Richard Hendricks in the [[HBO]] series ''[[Silicon Valley (TV series)|Silicon Valley]]'', for which he was nominated for a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series]]. He voiced Harold Hutchins in ''[[Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie]]'' (2017). Middleditch also appears in ads for [[Verizon Wireless]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fiercewireless.com/wireless/top-5-wireless-ads-t-mobile-spends-almost-30m-netflix-ads|title=The top 5 wireless ads: T-Mobile spends almost $30M on Netflix ads|website=FierceWireless.com|first=Mike|last=Dano|date=November 14, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/21/arts/television/thomas-middleditch-of-silicon-valley-on-doing-verizon-ads-and-flying-his-own-plane.html|title=Thomas Middleditch of 'Silicon Valley' on Doing Verizon Ads and Flying His Own Plane|website=[[The New York Times]]|first=Dave|last=Itzkoff|date=April 21, 2017}}</ref>
==Early life== Middleditch was born and raised in [[Nelson, British Columbia]].<ref name="BA">{{cite web|title=BA #085: Thomas Middleditch|url=http://boxangeles.com/2015/06/29/ba-085-thomas-middleditch/|date=June 29, 2015|website=Box Angeles podcast}}</ref> His parents are British.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theapiary.org/thebastion/2006/9/15/inside-with-thomas-middleditch-comedian-and-actor.html|title=Inside With: Thomas Middleditch, Comedian and Actor|last=McQuern|first=Elizabeth|date=September 15, 2006|website=TheApiary.org|accessdate=June 3, 2017}}</ref> He was cast in a play in grade eight which he said "changed everything" for him. He went from an indoorsy kid who was bullied, to becoming the funny, popular kid in high school. He discovered [[Improvisational theatre|improv]] in grade school from performing with [[Theatresports]].<ref name="BA"/>
He studied at the [[University of Victoria]] before moving to [[Toronto]], where he auditioned for and enrolled in [[George Brown College]], but never attended classes.<ref name="BA"/> He instead opted to make sketches on his own, and worked at a [[New Balance]] store for an income.<ref name="BA"/> He then relocated to [[Chicago]], where he took classes at [[The Second City]] and [[iO Theater]], while also performing regularly.<ref name="BA"/> Due to immigration issues, he worked various cash jobs until [[Charna Halpern]] sponsored him to get his [[Work permit|work visa]].<ref name="BA"/> While performing on a Second City cruise, he got an audition for ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''.<ref name="BA"/> Though he did not get cast, the routine he used in his audition landed him a network [[Talent holding deal|holding deal]] and he moved to [[New York City]].<ref name="BA"/>
==Career== [[File:Thomas Middleditch at SXSW 2016 (cropped).jpg|right|thumb|upright|Middleditch at [[SXSW 2016]]]] While living in New York City, Middleditch began acting in commercials. In 2007 a sketch video for [[Chicken McNuggets]] he made with Fernando Sosa in Chicago was purchased by [[McDonald's]] and used as a commercial.<ref name="BA"/><ref>{{cite web|title=McNuggets McNuggets...What?|url=http://adage.com/article/garfield-the-blog/mcnuggets-mcnuggets/119577/|date=July 27, 2007|website=AdAge}}</ref> He appeared in the 2009 romantic comedy ''[[Splinterheads]]'', portraying the lead role of Justin Frost.<ref name=Splinterheads>{{cite web|last=Debruge|first=Peter|title=Review: 'Splinterheads'|url=https://variety.com/2009/film/reviews/splinterheads-1200477598/|accessdate=February 2, 2014|website=Variety|date=November 5, 2009}}</ref> On March 25, 2010, he joined a [[CBS]] pilot ''Hitched'', written by [[Josh Schwartz]] and directed by [[Rob Greenberg]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=Two CBS pilots add cast members|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/imdb/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1004078625&vnu_special_account_code=thrsiteimdbpro|accessdate=February 4, 2014|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=March 25, 2010}}</ref> On May 5, 2011, Middleditch made his first appearance in ''[[Jake and Amir]]'', in the episode "Jake and Amir: Doobs".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.collegehumor.com/video/6500252/jake-and-amir-doobs|title=Jake and Amir: Doobs|date=May 5, 2011|website=CollegeHumor|accessdate=May 10, 2015}}</ref> He made several returns to the [[web series]].
On May 31, 2011, Middleditch joined the cast of the [[Paramount Pictures]]' comedy film ''[[Fun Size]]'', directed by Josh Schwartz.<ref>{{cite web|title=Johnny Knoxville, Unique Blend of Cast Join 'Fun Size' Comedy|url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/24792|accessdate=4 February 2014|website=Bloody Disgusting|date=May 31, 2011}}</ref> On August 8, 2011, he joined ''Road to Nardo'',<ref>{{cite web|last=Sneider|first=Jeff|title=Middleditch takes 'Road to Nardo'|url=https://variety.com/2011/film/news/middleditch-takes-road-to-nardo-1118041071/|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=Variety|date=August 8, 2011}}</ref> a film that would have been [[Scot Armstrong]]'s directorial debut. On December 12, 2011, he joined [[Jay Roach]]'s ''[[The Campaign (film)|The Campaign]]'', starring [[Will Ferrell]] and [[Zach Galifianakis]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Sneider|first=Jeff|title=Middleditch in Warners' team of 'Rivals'|url=https://variety.com/2011/film/news/middleditch-in-warners-team-of-rivals-1118047397/|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=Variety|date=December 12, 2011}}</ref>
On July 23, 2012, Middleditch joined the cast of the comedy film ''[[Someone Marry Barry]]'', directed and written by [[Rob Pearlstein]] and produced by [[Barry Josephson]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Kit|first=Borys|title=Tyler Labine, Damon Wayans Jr., Lucy Punch Starring in Comedy 'Someone Marry Barry'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/tyler-labine-damon-wayans-jr-lucy-punch-353224|accessdate=February 4, 2014|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=July 23, 2012}}</ref> On August 23, 2012, he had a role in ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]''{{'}}s final season episode "[[The Farm (The Office)|The Farm]]".<ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=Thomas Middleditch Cast As Dwight's Brother On 'The Office' Spinoff|url=http://deadline.com/2012/08/thomas-middleditch-cast-as-dwights-brother-on-the-office-spinoff/|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=Deadline.com|date=August 23, 2012}}</ref> He had a role in the 2013 comedy fantasy film ''[[The Brass Teapot]]'', directed by [[Ramaa Mosley]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Debruge|first=Peter|title=Film Review: 'The Brass Teapot'|url=https://variety.com/2013/film/reviews/film-review-the-brass-teapot-1200332230/|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=Variety|date=April 2, 2013}}</ref> and played a police officer in the 2013 [[CBS Films]] coming-of-age comedy film ''[[The Kings of Summer]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Cunningham|first=Todd|title='Toy's House' Goes to CBS Films|url=http://www.thewrap.com/movies/article/sundance-2013-toys-house-goes-cbs-films-74276|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=TheWrap|date=January 22, 2013}}</ref>
On January 30, 2013, Middleditch joined [[HBO]]'s comedy pilot ''[[Silicon Valley (TV series)|Silicon Valley]]'' playing Richard Hendricks.<ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=T.J. Miller, Thomas Middleditch Cast In Mike Judge's HBO Comedy Pilot 'Silicon Valley'|url=http://deadline.com/2013/01/t-j-miller-thomas-middleditch-cast-in-mike-judges-hbo-comedy-pilot-silicon-valley/|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=Deadline.com|date=January 30, 2013}}</ref> He has said that the pilot was written with him specifically in mind as the lead (the character was originally named Thomas Pickering; the latter being his mother's maiden name).<ref name="BA"/> This was a result of a "random" audio sketch he once made for a [[Stand-up comedy|stand-up]] routine which he would later animate himself and pitched to several people, including [[Mike Judge]]'s production partners [[John Altschuler]] and Dave Krinsky, who would later create the show.<ref name="BA"/>
In 2014 he joined a [[CollegeHumor]] series on youtube called CAMP.
For his work on the show, Middleditch has garnered two [[Satellite Awards]] nominations and two [[Critics' Choice Television Award]] nominations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2015/05/31/critics-choice-television-awards-winners-2015-full-list/|title=Critics' Choice Television Awards: HBO, ''Better Call Saul'', Taraji P. Henson and Amy Schumer Among Big Winners|website=[[TVLine]]|first=Matt Webb|last=Mitovich|date=May 31, 2015|accessdate=June 1, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pressacademy.com/award_cat/2015/|title=Satellite Awards (2015)|website=[[International Press Academy]]|accessdate=June 22, 2016|date=December 2, 2015}}</ref> In 2016, Middleditch earned his first [[Primetime Emmy Award]] nomination for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series|Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series]] for his performance in the show.<ref>{{cite web|last=Johnson|first=Zack|title=2016 Emmy Nominations: Complete List of Nominees|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/779715/2016-emmy-nominations-complete-list-of-nominees|website=E! Online|accessdate=July 14, 2016|date=July 14, 2016}}</ref>
On April 23, 2013, he was added to the cast of the comedy film ''[[Search Party (film)|Search Party]]'', the feature directorial debut of [[Scot Armstrong]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Kit|first=Borys|title='Search Party' Finds Its Stars, Begins Shooting Next Week|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/search-party-finds-stars-begins-444776|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=April 23, 2013}}</ref> Middleditch made a small cameo appearance in the 2013 film ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|The Wolf of Wall Street]]'' as a broker who is fired for cleaning his fish bowl during office hours.<ref>{{cite video|publisher=[[YouTube]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jxV2Jw1PDc0|title=The Wolf of Wall Street}}</ref>
He has played as a hipster thief in the episode "Sunday Funday" on the show ''[[You're The Worst]]''. On ''[[The Pete Holmes Show]]'', he played [[Nightcrawler (comics)|Nightcrawler]] and [[Gambit (comics)|Gambit]] from the ''[[X-Men]]'' and [[Vega (Street Fighter)|Vega]] and [[Ken Masters|Ken]] from ''[[Street Fighter II]]''. On October 16, 2013, it was announced that the [[Disney XD]]-produced animated series ''[[Penn Zero: Part-Time Hero]]'' would star Middleditch as the titular multiverse-hopping hero. The series premiered in late 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2013/10/disney-xd-orders-animated-series-penn-zero-part-time-hero/|title=Disney XD Orders Animated Series 'Penn Zero: Part-Time Hero'|website=Deadline.com|date=October 16, 2013}}</ref> In 2015, he co-starred in the films ''[[The Final Girls]]'' and ''[[The Bronze (film)|The Bronze]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/52884/four-more-sign-on-to-tangle-with-the-final-girls-including-the-vampire-diaries-nina-dobrev/|title=Four More Sign on to Tangle with The Final Girls Including The Vampire Diaries' Nina Dobrev|website=[[Dread Central]]|first=John|last=Squires|date=April 11, 2014|accessdate=April 27, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hitfix.com/news/sebastian-stan-cant-out-fox-thomas-middleditch-on-the-bronze-red-carpet|title=Sebastian Stan can't out-fox Thomas Middleditch on The Bronze red carpet|date=January 22, 2015|website=HitFix}}</ref> Also in 2015, he began streaming himself playing video games on the website [[Twitch.tv|Twitch]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.twitch.tv/middleditch|title=Twitch|website=Twitch}}</ref>
Middleditch voiced Harold Hutchins in [[DreamWorks Animation]]'s animated feature ''[[Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie]]'' (2017), based on [[Dav Pilkey]]'s book ''[[Captain Underpants]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Abramovitch|first=Seth|title=Ed Helms, Kevin Hart Slip Into DreamWorks Animation's 'Captain Underpants'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/ed-helms-kevin-hart-slip-673028|accessdate=February 4, 2014|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=January 21, 2014}}</ref> As of 2017, Middleditch has appeared in [[Verizon Communications|Verizon]] commercials as their spokesperson.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/21/arts/television/thomas-middleditch-of-silicon-valley-on-doing-verizon-ads-and-flying-his-own-plane.html|title=Thomas Middleditch of 'Silicon Valley' on Doing Verizon Ads and Flying His Own Plane|last=Itzkoff|first=Dave|date=April 21, 2017|website=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=June 4, 2017}}</ref> On May 31, 2017, he was cast in the [[MonsterVerse]] film ''[[Godzilla: King of the Monsters (2019 film)|Godzilla: King of the Monsters]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/godzilla-sequel-thomas-middleditch-silicon-valley-1202448069/|title='Silicon Valley' Star Thomas Middleditch Joins 'Godzilla' Sequel (EXCLUSIVE)|last=Kroll|first=Justin|website=Variety|date=May 31, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Middleditch became engaged to costume designer Mollie Gates in June 2015.<ref name=USM>{{cite web|last=Webber|first=Stephanie|title=Silicon Valley's Thomas Middleditch Engaged to Girlfriend Mollie Gates: "They're Both Very Happy"|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/silicon-valleys-thomas-middleditch-engaged-to-girlfriend-mollie-gates-201566|accessdate=July 16, 2015|website=[[Us Weekly]]|date=June 6, 2015}}</ref> They were married on August 22, 2015 in Middleditch's hometown.
Middleditch has described his own upbringing as [[agnosticism|agnostic]]. He believed in a "classic [[Christianity|Christian]] religion" at a young age. He has described himself as a Christian, but also as an atheist.<ref>{{cite podcast|title=Thomas Middleditch|website=Totally Laime|minutes=56|date=January 11, 2013|accessdate=June 18, 2015|url=http://www.totallylaime.com/2013/01/11/thomas-middleditch/}}</ref>

Role ! class="unsortable"| Notes |- | 2010 | ''[[Robotomy]]'' | rowspan="3"| Additional voices | Episode: "Bling Thing" |- | 2011 | ''[[Ugly Americans (TV series)|Ugly Americans]]'' | Episode: "Wet Hot Demonic Summer" |- | 2011 | ''[[Beavis and Butt-Head]]'' | 7 episodes |- | 2011 | ''[[The League]]'' | Julian | Episode: "The Light of Genesis" |- | 2011 | ''[[Fact Checkers Unit]]'' | Kerry | Episode: "Fly Like a Buttress" |- | 2013 | ''[[Newsreaders]]'' | Micah Berkley | Episode: "Auto Erotic" |- | 2013 | ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'' | Jeb Schrute | Episode: "[[The Farm (The Office)|The Farm]]" |- | 2013 | ''[[Key and Peele]]'' | [[Thénardiers|Monsieur Thénardier]] | Episode: "Les Mis" |- | 2013 | ''[[Trophy Wife (TV series)|Trophy Wife]]'' | Nurse Terry | Episode: "Lice and Beary White" |- | 2013 | ''[[The Pete Holmes Show]]'' | [[Gambit (comics)|Gambit]] / [[Nightcrawler (comics)|Nightcrawler]] | 2 episodes |- | 2014–present | ''[[Silicon Valley (TV series)|Silicon Valley]]'' | Richard Hendricks | Main cast |- | 2014 | ''[[You're the Worst]]'' | Hipster Ringleader | Episode: "Sunday Funday" |- | 2014–2017 | ''[[Penn Zero: Part-Time Hero]]'' | Penn Zero / Additional voices | 61 episodes; also writer: "Ultrahyperball" |- | 2015 | ''[[Paul Scheer|Scheer-RL]]'' | Jeff Timons | Episode: "98 Degrees" |- | 2015 | ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' | Himself / Tim Landers | 2 episodes |- | 2015–2016 | ''[[Drunk History]]'' | [[Sam Zemurray]] / [[William Willis (sailor)|William Willis]] | 2 episodes |- | 2016 | ''[[Great Minds with Dan Harmon]]'' | [[William Shakespeare]] | Episode: "William Shakespeare" |- | 2016 | ''[[TripTank]]'' | Warlock / Caller (voice) | Episode: "TripTank 2025" |- | 2017 | ''[[Animals.]]'' | Simon (voice) | Episode: "Rats." |- | 2017 | ''[[Rick and Morty]]'' | King Tommy (voice) | Episode: "The ABCs of Beth" |- | 2018 | ''[[Bob's Burgers]]'' | Alex (voice) | Episode: "Cheer Up Sleepy Gene" |}

Role ! class="unsortable"| Notes |- | 2009 | ''Memoirs of a Manchild'' | Danny Nanners | 3 episodes; also writer and producer |- | 2010 | ''The Back Room'' | [[Die Antwoord]] | Episode: "Steve Agee" |- | 2010–2013 | ''[[CollegeHumor|CollegeHumor Originals]]'' | Various characters | 20 episodes |- | 2011 | ''[[Funny or Die]]'' | Woodshed Guy | Episode: "2.8" |- | 2011 | ''Matumbo Goldberg'' | Lenny | 5 episodes |- | 2011–2015 | ''[[Jake and Amir]]'' | Penis Anthony "Doobs" Doubligner | 6 episodes |- | 2012 | ''[[Bravest Warriors]]'' | Professor Fartsparkles (voice) | Episode: "Time Slime" |- | 2013 | ''The Funtime Gang'' | Randy the Racoon | Episode: "Pilot" |- | 2013 | ''[[The Morning After (web series)|The Morning After]]'' | Dave | 5 episodes |- | 2016 | ''[[Harmonquest|HarmonQuest]]'' | Dildo Bogpelt | Episode: "The Doorest of Fores" |}
